intro: Tetrastigma leucostaphylum, commonly known as the white-stemmed vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. Tetrastigma leucostaphylum is often found in humid, tropical environments and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
